cashew anthracnose.description: Fungal disease causing dark brown spots on leaves, flowers, and young fruits.
symptoms: Dark brown irregular spots on leaves
cashew anthracnose.treatment: Apply copper-based fungicides during wet season. Prune affected branches and ensure good air circulation.
cashew anthracnose.prevention: Plant resistant varieties, improve drainage, avoid overhead irrigation during flowering

cashew gumosis.description: Bark disease causing gum exudation from trunk and branches.
cashew gumosis.treatment: Remove affected bark, apply fungicide paste, improve tree nutrition and drainage.
cashew gumosis.prevention: Avoid mechanical injuries, proper pruning practices, balanced fertilization
cashew gumosis.economic_impact: Can cause tree death if severe

cashew healthy.description: Cashew plant appears healthy with no visible disease symptoms.
cashew healthy.treatment: Continue regular monitoring and maintain good agricultural practices.
cashew healthy.prevention: Regular inspection, proper nutrition, and integrated pest management

cashew leaf miner.description: Insect pest creating serpentine mines in cashew leaves.
cashew leaf miner.treatment: Apply systemic insecticides, remove and destroy affected leaves, use pheromone traps.
cashew leaf miner.prevention: Regular monitoring, maintain field hygiene, encourage natural predators
cashew leaf miner.economic_impact: 10-25% yield reduction due to reduced photosynthesis

cashew red rust.description: Fungal disease causing reddish-brown pustules on leaf undersides.
cashew red rust.treatment: Apply copper-based fungicides, improve air circulation, reduce humidity around plants.
cashew red rust.prevention: Proper spacing, pruning for air circulation, avoid excessive moisture

cassava bacterial blight.description: Bacterial disease causing angular leaf spots and stem cankers.
symptoms: Angular leaf spots with yellow halos
cassava bacterial blight.treatment: Remove infected plants, apply copper-based bactericides, use resistant varieties.
cassava bacterial blight.prevention: Use certified disease-free planting material, crop rotation, field sanitation

cassava brown spot.description: Fungal disease causing brown spots with yellow halos on leaves.
symptoms: Brown circular spots with yellow margins
cassava brown spot.treatment: Apply fungicides, remove infected leaves, ensure proper plant spacing.
cassava brown spot.prevention: Use resistant varieties, improve air circulation, balanced fertilization

cassava green mite.description: Microscopic pest causing leaf yellowing and bronzing.
cassava green mite.treatment: Apply miticides, increase humidity around plants, release predatory mites.
cassava green mite.prevention: Regular monitoring, maintain field moisture, encourage natural enemies

cassava healthy.description: Cassava plant appears healthy with no visible disease symptoms.
cassava healthy.treatment: Continue regular monitoring and maintain good agricultural practices.
cassava healthy.prevention: Use healthy planting material, proper spacing, integrated pest management

cassava mosaic.description: Viral disease causing mosaic patterns and leaf distortion.
cassava mosaic.treatment: Remove infected plants immediately, control whitefly vectors, use resistant varieties.
cassava mosaic.prevention: Use certified virus-free planting material, control whiteflies, field sanitation

maize fall armyworm.description: Destructive pest caterpillar feeding on maize leaves and stems.
maize fall armyworm.treatment: Apply appropriate insecticides, use biological control agents, handpick larvae when possible.
maize fall armyworm.prevention: Early planting, crop rotation, intercropping, pheromone traps
maize fall armyworm.economic_impact: 20-70% yield loss depending on infestation level

maize grasshoper.description: Grasshopper pest causing defoliation and stem damage.
maize grasshoper.treatment: Apply contact insecticides, use biopesticides, encourage natural predators.
maize grasshoper.prevention: Field sanitation, remove alternate hosts, biological control

maize healthy.description: Maize plant appears healthy with no visible disease or pest damage.
maize healthy.treatment: Continue regular monitoring and maintain good agricultural practices.
maize healthy.prevention: Balanced nutrition, proper spacing, integrated pest and disease management

maize leaf beetle.description: Beetle pest causing characteristic hole patterns in maize leaves.
maize leaf beetle.treatment: Apply insecticides, use sticky traps, encourage beneficial insects.
maize leaf beetle.prevention: Crop rotation, field sanitation, resistant varieties

maize leaf blight.description: Fungal disease causing elongated lesions on maize leaves.
maize leaf blight.treatment: Apply fungicides, plant resistant varieties, remove crop residues.
maize leaf blight.prevention: Crop rotation, balanced fertilization, proper plant spacing

maize leaf spot.description: Fungal disease causing circular to oval spots on leaves.
symptoms: Circular brown spots with light centers
maize leaf spot.treatment: Apply fungicides, ensure good air circulation, remove infected debris.
maize leaf spot.prevention: Resistant varieties, crop rotation, balanced nutrition

maize streak virus.description: Viral disease causing characteristic streaking on maize leaves.
symptoms: Yellow-white streaks parallel to leaf veins
maize streak virus.treatment: Remove infected plants, control leafhopper vectors, use resistant varieties.
maize streak virus.prevention: Plant resistant varieties, control vectors, avoid late planting

tomato healthy.description: Tomato plant appears healthy with no visible disease symptoms.
tomato healthy.treatment: Continue regular monitoring and maintain good agricultural practices.
tomato healthy.prevention: Proper nutrition, adequate spacing, integrated disease management

tomato leaf blight.description: Fungal disease causing brown spots and leaf death in tomatoes.
tomato leaf blight.treatment: Apply fungicides, remove infected leaves, improve air circulation.
tomato leaf blight.prevention: Drip irrigation, mulching, crop rotation, resistant varieties

tomato leaf curl.description: Viral disease causing upward curling and thickening of tomato leaves.
tomato leaf curl.causes: Tomato leaf curl virus (transmitted by whiteflies)
tomato leaf curl.treatment: Remove infected plants, control whitefly vectors, use reflective mulch.
tomato leaf curl.prevention: Use virus-free seedlings, control whiteflies, resistant varieties

tomato septoria leaf spot.description: Fungal disease causing small circular spots with dark borders.
symptoms: Small circular spots with dark borders
tomato septoria leaf spot.treatment: Apply fungicides, remove lower leaves, ensure good air circulation.
tomato septoria leaf spot.prevention: Avoid overhead watering, mulch plants, crop rotation

tomato verticulium wilt.description: Soil-borne fungal disease causing wilting and yellowing.
tomato verticulium wilt.treatment: No cure available - remove infected plants, improve drainage, soil solarization.
tomato verticulium wilt.prevention: Use resistant varieties, soil sterilization, crop rotation with non-hosts
tomato verticulium wilt.economic_impact: Complete plant loss in severe cases
